course_classes.class_1: Overview of project-Technical Requirements-Notion and Concepts about React-React is a library for web interface creation-It's  is is used to build SPAs (Single Page Application)-Is Component Based-Use JSX to render HTML-Apply virtual DOM to make/execute changes from DOM-We can add it to an existing project or create a new one with React.
course_classes.class_2: We use 'create react app' (CRA) tool to create a react app-CRA is a script execution tool to create a React Application, where that execution is performed through 'nodejs' and 'npm'-'npm start' initialize a React app in dev
course_classes.class_3: JSX is similar to HTML, but it wrote inside a javascript code-Is mean way to write HTML with RactJS-We can interpolate variables by putting them inside { }-It's  possible to execute functions in JSX-Inser variables in  `tags atributtes` is algo possible
course_classes.class_4: Allow to split the Application in part-The Components render JSX such as APP.js-Component need a js file with same name. Components can be imported to any part of Application as many time you need-Normaly they stay in folder called  `components`-A Component is a javascript function, it name must be equal to his file name-They can be used in many other components
course_classes.class_5: props are values passed to a Component-They may be used dinamicaly-The value is passed as argument when calling a Component-That value need to be recovered from inside a parameter, usually `props`.-props are read only
course_classes.class_6: `CSS` can be added by global way to React App through 'index.css' file-However, it possible styling at Component level-For that, It used 'CSS modules'-Create a file with this pattern '[COMPONENT_NAME].module.css' and import that css file as with key 'styles' in its own Component-Inside CSS modules files, use classes name in `Camel case` or `snake case`
course_classes.class_7: `React fragments` allow to create a Component without a superior element-The purpose is `uncomplicate DOM nodes`-The syntax is `<> ... </>` without tag name-It created in JSX
course_classes.class_8: We can `define type for props`, making a kind of validation-We do it in an object called `PropTypes` in Component-It's  possible to set a default value-To do that, use object `defaultProps`
course_classes.class_9: Types: `onClick`, `onChange`, `onSubmit`-React events are the same events of DOM, we have events to respond a click-The event is associate to a tag that will execute it-Generally a `method` is assigned to the event-That `method` have to be `created in Component`
course_classes.class_10: `useState` is a React Hook-With it we can `manage the state` of a Component in a simple way-This Hook `works so well with events`-It's  possible to assign an event to state changing
course_classes.class_11: `Methods` can be passed by props also-In other words, a `Component child can activate a method from his father`-Let's access the method through an event-The syntax is the same as a data props:-Like this -> `props.methodName`
course_classes.class_12: We can define showing some element to a condition statement `IF`-That action is called by `Conditional Renderization`-For that we envolve the tags in `{ }`-Because { } allow to execute `javascript code`, so you create your condition-It's  possible to use `state`to create conditions.-OBS.: Always avoid creating complexo logics in templates JSX.
course_classes.class_13: For doing a list Renderization, first of all, we need an `array`-Then use `map` function to loop the list of itens-So, render and show something in screen-It's  possible to put together `Conditional operations and List Renderization`-To return an JSX template, must use `( )`
course_classes.class_14: `State Lift` is a technique used to share the `state`-It's  normal many components `depends on same state`-In that case, we centralize the state in the father Component, and `define who uses and who defines ( setState )`
course_classes.class_15: `React Router` is a package to change Application-So, we can access other pages without `page reload`-Only by changing aome app part, which change from a view to other-We need to install this package in the project via `npm install`-And then, make some changes on app strutructure
course_classes.class_16: `React Icons` is an external package of icons-We need to `add it to project through npm install`-It aloow us to add icons to project with a `Components-like syntax`-Moreover , `there are a big quantity of icons available`
